content.description: We found this boulder very fun.  It has a small roof off deck and gets very easy past this point.  This is the right hand route and it is temping to use the small boulder in front of this one to "cheat".  Climbing it directly is better if you want to challenge yourself.  The height of the boulder keeps things interesting.  Scramble down and walk off the back side to get down.
content.location: Approach this boulder from the main wash or the old asphalt road as described on the main area page.  This boulder is about 50 ft off the old asphalt road leg near the junction of these two approaches.  The approach is about 15 minutes.  There are two routes we identified up this boulder.  This is the right hand line as shown in the picture.

content.description: We found this boulder very fun.  It has a small roof off deck and gets very easy past this point.  The height of the boulder keeps things interesting.Scramble down and walk off the back side to get down.
content.location: Approach this boulder from the main wash or the old asphalt road as described on the main area page.  This boulder is about 50 ft off the old asphalt road leg near the junction of these two approaches.  The approach is about 15 minutes.  There are two routes we identified up this boulder.  This is the left hand line as shown in the picture.

content.description: This is a pretty sweet boulder just off the trail.  The crux of the routes are in the first couple moves, but the height of the boulder (about 20ft) keeps things interesting.
